qas.question: What type of generation of genetic material has a big part in making the genome what it is?
What is a possible product of duplications?
What role does genetic novelty play in the genome?

plausible_answers.text: extension of short tandem repeats, to duplication of a cluster of genes

qas.question: What is the first range of genetic novelty?
What are gene clusters a large part of?

plausible_answers.text: all the way to duplication of entire chromosomes or even entire genomes

qas.question: How far can genetic novelty go?
What is the first example of genetic novelty?

context: <a0_0>Duplications<a0_0/> play <b2_0>a major role<b2_0/> in shaping the genome.
